duties_responsibilities.duty: Deliver assigned summer camp programs and associated engagement activities
Lead the development and management of multiple residential and day-camp summer programs
Execute a plan for stewardship of key relationships with medical groups, hospitals, schools, families, and community partners
Responsible for meeting revenue goals and program service fees across a portfolio of camp programs
Support quarterly program budget reviews and managing expenses to budget across a portfolio of camps
Support content development and year-round communication with families
Manage the ordering, receiving, and storing of necessary supplies for a portfolio of camp programs
Implement Association medical, crisis, and risk management procedures
Execute long-term operations and business plan strategies for the sustainability of the camp programs
Execute marketing and communications plan to increase brand awareness and participation in camp programs
Lead integrated stakeholder teams that drive success across various departments

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience/work history in Health Education, Youth Development, Recreation, Public health, Health Administration, Business Administration, Project Management, or other related field (Master's preferred)
Minimum of 2 years of residential camp experience in a leadership or management role
